indicators.justification:
CRVS information is available such as follows :

A) CRVS is being managed and maintained by a few departments/ministries through an online application systems and/or portal as follows :
   i) Department of Statistics (DOSM). URL: https://www.dosm.gov.my/v1/index.php?r=column/cthemeByCat&cat=430&bul_id=SUV0bUN2UmQ2M2F4NmkxZjZ3azhiZz09&menu_id=L0pheU43NWJwRWVSZklWdzQ4TlhUUT09# 
   ii) National Registration Department, Ministry of Home Affairs. a)Online Birth Registration System 
       portal which is open to citizens who want to register births. URL: 
          https://osdftrlhr.jpn.gov.my/indexi.php
       b) Marriage Application system URL: https://oskc.jpn.gov.my/ c) Updating of Marriage 
          Records/Divorce URL: https://oskc.jpn.gov.my/  d) Registration of Death URL: 
          https://www.jpn.gov.my/en/core-business/death/peninsular/kematian-daftar-biasa-sm-eng
   iii) Royal Malaysian Police System which is not open to the public. 
   iv) Ministry of Health - Medical Care Information System which is not open to public.
   v) Federal and States Religious Department - marriage & divorce statistics escalated to DOSM.
   vi) Department of Syariah Judiciary Malaysia - marriage & divorce statistics escalated to DOSM.
B) CRVS data is also available as open data in Malaysia Open Data Portal under :
   i) National Statistics cluster. URL: https://www.data.gov.my/data/en_US/group/statistik-kebangsaan
   ii) Health cluster. URL: https://www.data.gov.my/data/en_US/group/kesihatan

CRVS open datasets in Malaysia Open Data portal are updated regularly.

indicators.justification:
Near realtime information on the healthcare system and COVID-19 has only recently been made available (June and July 2021, after the research period). [1][2] This data goes back to March 2020 on COVID-19 updates, and February 2020 on immunizations. Thus for the research period there are no relevant datasets in existence.

[1] Covid-19 open data git-hub URL: https://github.com/MoH-Malaysia/covid19-public
[2] Covid-19 immunization open data git-hub URL: https://github.com/CITF-Malaysia/citf-public open datasets are updated regularly.

indicators.justification:
Data on lobby register is not found although a plan or strategy about it was present/available as below:
i) The Prime Minister of Malaysia Datuk Seri Najib Razak in 20 August 2015 announced that a national consultative committee on political funding was formed to develop a plan to ensure transparency and governance over party funds. URL: a) https://www.theedgemarkets.com/article/najib-unveils-new-committee-develop-political-funding-laws. URL: b) https://www.astroawani.com/berita-malaysia/pm-umum-penubuhan-jawatankuasa-konsultatif-nasional-mengenai-pembiayaan-politik-69817

However, the President of the Association of Certified Fraud Examiners (ACFE), Malaysia Branch recently in 30 July 2021 said that the decision made by the previous "Jawatankuasa Konsultatif Nasional Mengenai Pembiayaan Politik (JKNMPP) - National Consultative Committee on Political Funding" needed to be taken since the committee consists of various experts and the proposed model is also taken from foreign countries. He also said that the political funds act should be enacted to control the funding of any party to political parties during the election season and the absence of the act is also seen as making it difficult for the Malaysian Anti-Corruption Commission (MACC) to conduct an investigation. URL: https://www.utusan.com.my/nasional/2021/07/guna-model-jawatankuasa-konsultatif-nasional/

Furthermore, National Consultative Committee on Political Funding Report in 29 August 2016 (in Malay language) in summary consists of 6 Guiding Principles for a political financing reform and 32 concrete proposals that need to be taken into action to improve the integrity of the country's political financing process.

ii) National Anti-Corruption Plan 2019-2023 (NACP) was launched by the Prime Minister of Malaysia Tun Mahathir in January 2019. New legislation on governing Political Funding and an offence on lobbying is one of the top priorities under the Strategy Priorities: Highlight of 22 Initiatives, Page 36 which indicate that the first initiative of Strategy 1 is 'To introduce new legislation on governing Political Funding and to include an offence on lobbying'. This initiative has the Strategic Objective of '1.2: Ensuring Better Transparency and Accountability in Government's Administration' and fall into 'Quadrant A' which means high impact and less complexity which require less effort to implement and will provide the quickest results in the transformation towards better governance in the country.

However, the progress of this new legislation is not known.

The data contains information about the money spent on each interaction between a lobbyist and a public official.

indicators.justification: Although there is a policy/regulation/guidelines on public consultations as stipulated in 'Pekeliling Kemajuan Pentadbiran Awam Bil.2 Tahun 2015 - Pengurusan Laman Web Agensi Sektor Sektor Awam (Public Administration Development Circular No.2 Year 2015 - Management of Public Sector Agency Website)' which consist of 'Guidelines on the Management of the Public Sector Agency Website' as Appendix 1 (URL: https://www.jmg.gov.my/mengenai-kami/berita-semasa/pengumuman/322-hebahan-pekeliling-kemajuan-pentadbiran-awam-pkpa-bil-2-tahun-2015-dan-pekeliling-am-pa-bil-1-tahun-2015; https://www.malaysia.gov.my/portal/content/30045), data on public consultation is being managed and maintained by every ministry. However, the data is not available on-line. Due to this, an interview was conducted with a person-in-charge of e-participation/e-consultation/e-decision making data from the Information Management Division, Economic Planning Unit. The above indicators/questions are answered based on the interview.

responses.subquestion_text: Is this data available online in any form?
The data includes proposed regulations.
The data includes a full set of public comments generated through public consultation processes.
The data includes supporting information, such as notices of intent and reasoned responses.
The data includes final regulations and justifications.
The data includes details of challenges to regulations that have passed through public consultation processes, as well as the results of these challenges.
Dataset is available free of charge.

indicators.justification:
Training to develop data literacy for public servants is being planned and organized by MAMPU to all ministries at the national level in accordance with the Public Sector ICT Strategic Plan Year 2016-2020 and Public Sector Digitalization Plan Year 2021-2025; 
either through the Public Sector Big Data Analytics projects with the aim to enable agencies to have the capability of in-house development of big data analytics in their respective agencies or specific capability/competency development in data matters such as data science/data professionals training/ certification course. URL:
i) https://www.malaysia.gov.my/portal/content/30591
ii) https://www.malaysia.gov.my/portal/content/30646
However, there are budget constraints/limitations.

Due to this issue, these trainings were offered to national public servants from all ministries. State government agencies were not included in Eleventh Malaysia Plan (11MP). In spite of that, universities are offering training to all including sub-national and local public servants.

responses.response_text: There is widespread and regular evidence of government supporting civil servants training on data matters, as part of a planned and sustainable strategy.

Training delivered covers data analysis, visualisations and storytelling techniques.

Training on data addresses non-technical public servants.
Training on data is focused on specific positions already working with data.
Training is planned by an established training team, department, or agency.
Public servants receive a certification when taking a training so there is a formal recognition as a professional development.

indicators.justification:
There is a common identifier such as National Digital ID (a uniquely credential person's identity on the internet) or Malaysia Identity Card (MyKad) Number (for malaysian citizen) or Passport Number (for non-citizen) that can facilitate mapping flows across the data ecosystem. However, National Digital ID is still under research & development. URL: https://www.malaysia.gov.my/portal/content/30592

Presently, only some political integrity datasets in the country are  made open to the public and the rest are not available yet. The available datasets related to legal person are using common identifiers such as Malaysia Identity Card (MyKad) Number (for malaysian citizen) or Passport Number (for non-citizen). Whereas, company information is using registration numbers from Companies Commission of Malaysia (SSM). Other datasets such as lobbying data, political finance data, lobbying registers are still not available.

responses.response_text: The datasets use a limited number of common identifiers.
responses.subquestion_text: There is evidence that datasets share common identifiers.
The key datasets for this theme share common identifiers that facilitate mapping flows across the data ecosystem.
The different political integrity datasets use common identifiers for public officials.
Lobbying data and political finance data share common identifiers for lobbyist clients and party and campaign donors.
Lobbying registers and public consultation data use common identifiers for regulations.
Asset declarations and political finance disclosures share common identifiers for interests, assets, and liabilities.
The various datasets share common identifiers for legal persons associated with donations, interests, assets, liabilities, and lobbying activities.
The key datasets for the political integrity and company information modules share common identifiers that facilitate mapping flows across the data ecosystem.
The key datasets for the political integrity and land modules share common identifiers that facilitate mapping flows across the data ecosystem.
The key datasets for the political integrity and public finance modules share common identifiers that facilitate mapping flows across the data ecosystem.
The key datasets for the political integrity and public procurement modules share common identifiers that facilitate mapping flows across the data ecosystem.

responses.response_text: There is partial consistency; several categories of identifiers are consistent across multiple datasets or whole identification systems are consistent across at least two datasets.
responses.subquestion_text: To what degree do the datasets associated with this theme use consistent identifiers and identification systems for elements that appear in more than one dataset?

indicators.justification:
There is a guideline that has been implemented on collecting beneficial ownership namely "Guidelines for the Reporting Framework for Beneficial Ownership of Legal Persons" as set out in the consultation document at SSM portal. 

There is a transitional period from 1 March 2002 ending 31 December 2020, existing companies and limited liability partnerships are required to obtain and keep the BO information accurate and up-to-date at the companies and limited liability partnerships' level.

After the transitional period from 1 January 2021 onwards, the companies are obliged to obtain, keep and update the BO information & notify the Registrar. 

 
URL: 

https://www.ssm.com.my/Pages/Legal_Framework/Public-Consultation.aspx

https://www.ssm.com.my/Pages/Legal_Framework/Document/Guideline%20for%20BO%20Reporting%20Framework%20(27022020).pdf

indicators.justification:
Personal Data Protection Act 2010 (Act 709) applies to all processing of personal data in the country and applies to the whole country. However this act is related to commercial transactions. 

There is a review on this act in 2020 called the Public Consultation Paper No. 01/2020 – Review of Personal Data Protection Act 2010 (PC01/2020)

URL: https://www.kkmm.gov.my/pdf/Personal%20Data%20Protection%20Act%202010.pdf

The framework requires data controllers to notify an appropriate authority of data breaches.
Frameworks explicitly cover the protection of location-related data.
The framework addresses algorithmic decision making.

indicators.justification:
Pekeliling Kemajuan Pentadbiran Awam Bil.2 Tahun 2015 - Pengurusan Laman Web Agensi Sektor Sektor Awam (Public Administration Development Circular No.2 Year 2015 - Management of Public Sector Agency Website)' which consists of 'Guidelines on the Management of the Public Sector Agency Website' as Appendix 1. This circular was issued on 30th September 2015 by the Chief Secretary to the Government of Malaysia and circulated to all Ministry Secretaries-General, Federal Heads of Department, State Government Secretaries, Federal and State Statutory Authorities and Local Authorities in the country. URL: https://www.mampu.gov.my/en/circulars/category/182-2018

Furthermore, this circular explains about the implementation of the myGovernment Portal (the Government of Malaysia's official portal) as a public sector information gateway; emphasizing the importance of website governance at the public sector level and at the agency level; and provide guidance to public sector agencies in developing and maintaining their respective agency websites. The management of public sector agency websites should be implemented in accordance with this circular/guidelines.

indicators.justification:
1) The implementation of Open Data in the public sector is based on Open Data Programs which are guided by the circular/guidelines on open data namely 'General Circular No.1 Year 2015 - Implementation of the Public Sector Open Data Initiatives', strategic plans and supported by  Eleventh Malaysia Plan (11MP) in the perspective of budget. This circular binds together the 'Guidelines on the Implementation of the Public Sector Open Data Initiative' as Appendix 1. URL: https://www.data.gov.my/p/pekeliling-data-terbuka

2) MAMPU, as the entrusted agency to spearhead the implementation of data driven initiatives in the public sector, has developed open data & big data analytics programs since 2016, based on this circular and public sector strategic plans namely Public Sector ICT Strategic Plan Year 2016-2020 and Public Sector Digitalization Plan Year 2021-2025 including capacity and capability development in open data, data science and certification courses of data professionals such as data engineer, data analyst and data scientist. 

3) The public sector strategic plan outlines the strategic direction of ICT implementation (year 2016-2020) and digitalization (year 2021-2025) comprise of  strategic thrust, strategies, programs and action plans. 
Public Sector ICT Strategic Plan Year 2016-2020
has 5 strategic thrusts namely integrated digital services, data driven government (data driven initiatives), shared services, governance and professional & capable work force. On the other hand the Public Sector Digitalization Plan Year 2021-2025 encompasses 7 strategic thrusts namely harnessing data intelligence, integrated digital services, governance, human capital (capability & competency development), secured shared services, promotion & publicity and emerging technology adoption. URL: https://www.mampu.gov.my/wp-content/uploads/2021/08/The-Malaysian-Public-Sector-ICT-Strategic-Plan-2016_2020.pdf

evidence.title: RINGKASAN EKSEKUTIF PELAN STRATEGIK PENDIGITALAN SEKTOR AWAM (PSPSA) 2021-2025 (VERSI BETA 3.0)
The Malaysian Public Sector ICT Strategic Plan 2016-2020
Engagement Sessions and Open Data Coaching Programs

The framework establishes a common definition of open data.
The framework promotes open licensing without any restrictions beyond attribution and share-alike.
The framework requires to publish data in machine readable formats.
The rules/guidance requires the use of specific data standards.
The framework promotes training and capacity building among government officials.

indicators.justification:
Regulations/guidelines requiring collection or publication of public finances are as follows :
i) 'General Circular No.1 Year 2015 - Implementation of the Public Sector Open Data Initiatives' which consists of 'Guidelines on the Implementation of the Public Sector Open Data Initiative' as Appendix 1. This circular was issued on 30th September 2015 by the Chief Secretary to the Government of Malaysia which aims to provide guidelines on the implementation of open data in public sector. URL: https://www.data.gov.my/p/pekeliling-data-terbuka

Furthermore, the guidelines aim to provide guidance to public sector agencies in implementing the public sector open data initiatives towards sharing of government data, quality improvement and transparency of service delivery as well as to encourage economic growth of the country through innovations.
MAMPU (central agency under Prime Minister's Department) as the entrusted agency to spearhead the implementation of data driven initiatives has developed open data & big data analytics programs based on this circular, Public Sector ICT Strategic Plan Year 2016-2020 and Public Sector Digitalization Plan Year 2021-2025. These data driven programs consist of strategies and activities such as roadshows, engagement, training etc and action plans.

ii) 'Pekeliling Kemajuan Pentadbiran Awam Bil.2 Tahun 2015 - Pengurusan Laman Web Agensi Sektor Sektor Awam (Public Administration Development Circular No.2 Year 2015 - Management of Public Sector Agency Website)' which consist of 'Guidelines on the Management of the Public Sector Agency Website' as Appendix 1. URL: https://www.mampu.gov.my/en/circulars/category/182-2018

The coverage of the above circular (guidelines) are national level. However, over time, the content of the circular has room for improvement.

evidence.title: General Circular No.1 Year 2015 - Implementation of the Public Sector Open Data Initiatives

The rules/guidance support the collection of structured data.

indicators.justification:
Freedom of Information Enactments are already operational in two states of the country namely Selangor (THE FREEDOM OF INFORMATION (STATE OF SELANGOR) ENACTMENT 2010) and Penang (PENANG FREEDOM OF INFORMATION ENACTMENT 2010).

Besides that, at national level, the government already has plan, strategy and started to formulate the act as follows :
    a) 'Govt to draft Freedom of Information Act to replace Official Secrets Act 1972', Prime Minister Tun Dr Mahathir Mohamad in 18 July 2019 said.
    b) 'Government to study the Official Secret Act 1972 (OSA) and Freedom of Information', Minister in Prime Minister's Department said. URL: http://www.bheuu.gov.my/index.php/media/keratan-akhbar/1255-govt-to-study-osa-freedom-of-information-act
    c) Minister in Prime Minister's Department has delivered a Keynote Address in 27 November 2019 for National Stakeholders Consultation on the Right to Information/Freedom of Information. URL: 
http://www.bheuu.gov.my/pdf/ucapan/TEKS%20UCAPAN%20YBM/Keynote%20Address%20Minister-RTI_%20BHEUU.pdf;
 http://www.bheuu.gov.my/index.php/media/galeri-gambar/1666-27-28-november-2019-national-stakeholders-consultation-on-the-right-to-information-legislation

indicators.justification:
There is evidence that company data is being used. 
SSM Annual Report 2018 (page 45) indicates that SSM consistently conducts new product development to ensure that SSM meets the needs of customers and stakeholders, in line with the industry's demand for information on business entities in Malaysia. In 2018, SSM introduced three (3) new products that are available online via the MyDATA-SSM portal namely 'Particulars of company secretary', 'Audit firm profile' and 'Company listing'. Furthermore, SSM Annual Report 2018 (page 42) also indicates that there were more than 1.25 millions transactions in 2017 and more than 1.31 millions transactions in 2017. indicators.justification:
There is evidence of government procurement data being analyzed to improved procurement practice.
MAMPU send two groups of representatives from Malaysia to participate in the Presidential Hackathon 2019 organized by the Taiwan Government in collaboration with the Open Contracting Partnership (OCP). One of the team developed a data-driven innovation with Artificial Intelligent features entitled "Cartelogy" to detect the existence of fraudulent offers in government procurement. Moreover, "Cartelogy" detects revenue leakages in government procurement by examining the patterns and relationships between companies, tenders and company owners and subsequently identifies risks of the existence of bid fraud and government procurement leakage during the evaluation and decision-making process of the appointed committee. Besides that, "Cartelogy" is a proactive and preventative tool to identify potential bid-rigging and corruption risks in public procurement at the tender stages before contracts are even awarded.  By developing and deploying a "red flag" mechanism/tool to analyse, evaluate, detect potentially suspicious activities from the outset, respective decision makers (as well as oversight committees and relevant authorities) will be better equipped to make informed procurement evaluation and contract award decisions. This will reduce the probability of contracts being awarded to 'phantom', 'crony' or colluding companies and expose conflicts of interests or personal relationships between public officials and companies. URL:
i) https://www.malaysia.gov.my/portal/content/30753
ii) https://www.prnewswire.com/news-releases/president-tsai-awards-the-winning-teams-in-the-2019-presidential-hackathon-finals-demonstrating-the-openness-of-taiwans-commitments-to-open-government-open-data-and-strength-of-applied-social-innovation-300892951.html
